revised_title: Structure and Formation of Metal Films: Magnesium, Zinc, and Aluminium
tldr: The authors investigate the structure and formation of metal films, specifically magnesium, zinc, and aluminium, using electron diffraction techniques. They find that the crystalline structure of these films is due to the aggregation of atoms upon their arrival at the receiver. The study also observes remarkable cases of crystal distortion due to pseudomorphic effects.
